data.title: Missing Text in titles and sections, and extensions.  Can see icons with --disable-gpu, but not text
data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.8.1 
ee428b0eead68bf0fb99ab5fdc4439be227b6281
- OS Version:
Centos 7.3.1611 (Core)
3.10.0-514.2.2.el7.x86_64
GDM 3.14.2
XFCE 4.12
Steps to Reproduce:

1. Install Centos 7.3 minimal from ISO - create a user as well
2. log in as root
3. ```yum install epel-release wget -y```
3. ```yum groupinstall "X Window system"```
4. ```yum groupinstall xfce```
5. ```systemctl set-default graphical.target```
6. ```reboot```
7. log in as user
8. download the vs code rpm
9. ```sudo yum localinstall <vscode.rpm>```
10. run ```code```
11. Extensions shows a blank panel
12. exit code
13. run ```code with --disable-gpu```
14. Extensions shows icons with no words

![vscode-icons-only](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/694054/21816596/3de3b9ee-d726-11e6-911c-8a8a6176b9cf.png)

output of ```code --disable-gpu --verbose``` then selecting extensions waiting for icons to load
```
code --disable-gpu --verbose
[7814:0110/111718:WARNING:audio_manager.cc(314)] Multiple instances of AudioManager detected
[7814:0110/111718:WARNING:audio_manager.cc(275)] Multiple instances of AudioManager detected
```

data.title: Multiline object properties
data.body:
In node and node2, I see this when looking at an object with multiline properties like `{ 'a\nb': 'c\nd' }`

In the variables pane, everything lost after the first newline:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/323878/21815934/3284f6fc-d713-11e6-8078-d9f6cb38c0de.png)

In the console, preview and prop name are split:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/323878/21815896/0d73237a-d713-11e6-902f-3509374f699a.png)

If I remember correctly, we decided that the debug adapter should return the actual value, and the client should display it however it supports it, right? I can't find that discussion. Or should the debug adapter be escaping the newlines in this case?

data.title: Generated sourcemaps in vscode build are broken. Blocks debugging vscode sourcecode with source maps
data.body:
After building .js.map files aren't emitting the right information

```
{"version":3,"file":"commonCodeEditor.js","sourceRoot":"file:///Users/noj/git/vscode/src","sources":["/src/vs/editor/common/commonCodeEditor.js"],"names":[],"mappings":";;;;;;IAAA;;;oGAGgG;IAChG,YAAY,CAAC;IA6Bb,IAAO,iBAAiB,GAAG,
```

This should be 

```
{"version":3,"file":"commonCodeEditor.js","sourceRoot":"file:///Users/noj/git/vscode/","sources":["/src/vs/editor/common/commonCodeEditor.ts"],"names":[],"mappings":";;;;;;IAAA;;;oGAGgG;IAChG,YAAY,CAAC;IA6Bb,IAAO,iBAAiB,GAAG,
```

sources should be ts files and sourceRoot should not include src folder. This was working in december but I can no longer debug vscode source with source maps enabled. 

I looked into build/lib/compilation.ts to see if I could figure it out. The build system looks quite complicated than what I am used to.

As a work around I am just going oldschool and debugging js files. Its a painful experience but gets the job done.

data.title: Integrated Terminal not auto-scrolling
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Insider (1.9.0-insider)
- OS Version: Mac OSX

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open integrated terminal
2. Do a command which will output text which should scroll the window
3. The window is not scrolled all the way to the bottom


This is something which is only happening very recently in the Insider build (last day or 2)

data.title: Fix bug in decorationRenderHelper
data.body:
getCSSTextForModelDecorationContentClassName will not escape ' in contentText since its escaping " rather than '

_CSS_MAPcontentText: 'content:\'{0}\';' uses single apostrophe so we need to escape ' rather than "

This is a bug that was always present and breaks inlineValueDebugging feature I am working on #16129

data.title: Allow task bindings (like Task Runner Explorer's ProjectOpened/SolutionOpened)
Revisit the 'add configuration' button UI to add a configuration snippet
[Proposal] Move git related extensions from properties to git

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
In [vscode-icons](https://github.com/robertohuertasm/vscode-icons) we are leveraging the power of `languageIds` to associate filenames and file extensions for those that are supported. What I have noticed is that all `git` related filenames are under the `properties` `languageId` (`extensions/ini/`), which is kinda odd, since there is already a `git` `languageId`. Consider moving them from `properties` to `git`.

While we are at it, could you please add any remaining `git` related filenames to it (i.e `.gitignore`, `.gitkeep`)?

The theme I created still has the colors I applied the old way, but making edits to my tmTheme file as before and refreshing has no effect.  Did you change the theme format?  If so, is there documentation for us theme authors?

data.title: Improve Extension UI

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Current Extension UI causes quiet number of dialogs during an extension managing lifecycle. It would be better to reduce them with nicer UI. 

Also improve representation of an extension.

- [ ] [When I presss "reload", an unnecessary confirm dialog appears](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/18039)
- [ ] [Extra confirmation message seems weird](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/14412)
- [ ] ["Reload this window to activate the extension X" - wording](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/17432)
- [ ] ["UX: Extension should have visual indication of globally/locally enabled](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/14472)
- [ ] ["Bad layout for extensions with empty description](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/14475)

data.title: diffEditor.ignoreTrimWhitespace does not work correctly if only whitespace is changed

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body: - VSCode Version: 1.8.1 - Monaco Version: 0.7.0 - OS Version: macOS 10.12 I initially stumbled upon this using the Monaco Editor, but could also reproduce it using VSCode. Steps to Reproduce (see images below): 1. Create a JS file with a function indented with spaces 2. Create another JS file (or commit the file with git) with the exact same function, but indented with tabs 3. Diff the two files/versions with `"diffEditor.ignoreTrimWhitespace": true` The indentation whitespace **is not ignored**. If you change anything else, such as the function name, the whitespace **is ignored**.

data.title: Problems view: support navigation by keyboard similar to search
data.body:
Now that we seem to have support in search to navigate using keyboard via @roblourens changes, I suggest to do the same in the problems view where you typically have many entries for the same file and this pattern makes sense.

I see some code that throttles keyboard events to prevent too many open events. Maybe this code should be moved down to the tree so that upstream tree users can adopt this pattern?

data.title: Adopt node.js path over our paths library

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
* [ ] We should try to reduce methods like `path.relative()` from our library and use node.js instead which covers more cases better.
* [x] Same is true for `path.isAbsolute()`.
* [ ] `path.dirname()`

data.title: Decorators Break TypeScript Reference Code Lens
Add Go To Implementation Api
data.body:
Fixes #10806

Adds a new API for supporting  `go to implementation` type commands in languages. Implements an example for TS

The current approach added a new public interface called `ImplementationProvider` (a suggestions for a better name would be appreciated). This resulted in some duplicate code that I will try to clean up further. An alternate design would be to extend the `DefintionProvider` with an optional `provideImplemtnation` method. This would allow reusing our existing internal interfaces without as much duplication, but we may want to keep the two concepts separate. Please let me know if you have any thoughts one way or the other.

data.title: How about support 'project' unit in VSCode?
data.body:
There is no plan of 'Project' unit support ?
I Know.. VSCode is NOT IDE. It's Editor....
But...
I Think... IF VSCode support project then it's very helpful for many developers...

for example some project is not compose single directory..,
some project compose many directory... 

this time, VSCode open many directory and VSCode's workspace tree also open many directory.
if VSCode support project unit then.. these many opened directory's root is project and it's very simple control for developer.. even if each directory's real path's root is not same...
it's just very simple e.g...
I Think.. if VSCode support project unit then there are many benefit for developer...
how about your think?

data.title: Sometime VS Code Debugger will Crash (PowerShell Extension) then odd things happen
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.8.1 (ee428b0eead68bf0fb99ab5fdc4439be227b6281, 2016-12-19T14:49:23.350Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14986
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|python|donjayamanne|0.5.5|
|beautify|HookyQR|0.7.3|
|rest-client|humao|0.11.4|
|PowerShell|ms-vscode|0.8.0|

---

Steps to Reproduce:
Not sure if this is with VS Code or the PowerShell Extension. 

Apologies for the woolly title and no step to replicate, but this is odd to say the least. Sometime, the VS Code debugger will hang when debugging a  PS script. I can't restart the debugger, but eventually, after pressing the stop button several times it will stop. However, pressing play results in a blue scrolling time line above the debug pane, and when I click stop this time I retrieve an error saying the debugger has crashed. 

Debug will not start until I have exited and restart Vs-code, but things to not stop there.  I threw together a simple test of some functions in an attempt to replicate an odd behaviour I was seeing through a pipeline (running the through the VS PS Debugger), and even more odd behaviours were seen, such as the Process block of the second function in the pipeline running before the process block on the first function. In another script I was also seeing other pipeline functions fire (and of course fail) when simply stepping over  a command in the current function (for example, a New-Item command to create a directory, or a '&' call out to another process. Even shutting down and restarting VS Code seem to do nothing.

Eventually I rebooted, but pretty sure this too too didn't do much either, until I change so code in `For Each-Object` loop, then eventually VS Code started behaving. 

It was almost as it VS Code hadn't cleared some kind of internal stack and kept reverted to old path, or some such when the debugger was run.

Not sure if you can understand what I'm explaining, or if I can replicate, but this has been going on an off for a while. If there are file I can provide, let me know.

data.title: ES6 React autocompletion
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

Hello guys I'm currently writing code and I'm trying to use ES6 

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6282239/21785006/24b7b7a8-d6be-11e6-8342-80bc4ccfbf26.png)

Here I got autocompletion but inside component is nothing..

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6282239/21785095/6d4e49dc-d6be-11e6-8215-083709a82d0a.png)

Even that if I use old way everything works perfectly:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6282239/21785143/9ccd04a0-d6be-11e6-8da4-f7c7b5a3dbe4.png)

Changing import to require is not helping..
I installes typings `typings install dt~react --global --save`


Someone know what is going on ?

Currently I read: 
> Since VS Code's JavaScript support doesn't understand ES7 constructs, features like IntelliSense might not be fully accurate.
from [](https://code.visualstudio.com/Docs/languages/javascript)

data.title: Changelog replaces open file
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.8.1 (ee428b0eead68bf0fb99ab5fdc4439be227b6281, 2016-12-19T14:42:49.304Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.3.0
- Extensions:
None

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Upgrade version, 
2. Open vscode with no tabs open
3. Save an empty document
4. Saved document is replaced with the changelog

This also happened yesterday when I first noticed it although I didnt keep track of the steps to reproduce. In this situation I had multiple tabs open and the document that was replaced with the changelog was the one I had just opened. I hadn't used vscode for a while previously.
